did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Sandy Dwyer is a lesbian activist, playwright and journalist living and working in Los Angeles, California. This collection represents materials used by and produced by Sandy Dwyer in the course of her life. The bulk are scripts and promotional materials.
did.physloc: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. Advance notice required for access. Contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. Advance notice required for access. Contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sandy Dwyer papers (Collection 2166). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Provenance unknown. This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Sandy Dwyer was born Sandra Jean Nelson in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. She was raised on a ranch in the Ozarks of Missouri by her parents who were rodeo producers. She received her Masters degree at the University of Missouri. She spent time as a trapeze artist, biology teacher, trick rope artist, social worker, gardener, actor and playwrite. Sandy Dwyer came out as a lesbian in 1986 and became involved with the Los Angeles gay and lesbian community. She co-founded a newspaper focused on local gay and lesbian news and events called The News. The paper was known for its hard hitting journalism and gained notoriety for exposing financial abuses by large mainstream gay and lesbian non profit organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials used and produced by Sandy Dwyer predominantly through the 1970s and 1980s. Included are plays written by Sandy as well as programs and other promotional materials from theater productions in which she was involved. Correspondence of both a personal and professional nature are represented. Work materials from the Department of Public Social Services are also included as are research materials used for various jobs.
Cotton shirts from various lesbian and feminist events and organizations.
Cotton shirts from various lesbian and feminist events and organizations.

Includes an audience marketing plan for Media West Productions as well as correspondence. Also included are a sample format, program descriptions, demographics, sponsorship information and advertising rates for Sunday Brunch Radio.
Newsletters from various gay and lesbian activist organizations, correspondence with these organizations. Also includes press releases and newspaper clippings.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The original label on this folder was "Some papers from my tenure at DPSS - Medical Division. My position was Program Assistant."

did.unittitle: Department of Public Social Services - Sandy Dwyer.

scopecontent.p: Original label "When with DPSS as Program Assistant in Medi-Cal - I wrote the enclosed memos and developed the forms - you can tell from initials in lower left of cover sheet - example - RLC (Program Lead:Robert L. Chaffee - one who approves) : SN (Sandra Nelson - one who writes) : CLL (Cynthis L. Luna - one who types it)

did.physdesc: greeting cards, handwritten notes, printed paper

scopecontent.p: Jounal entries, newspaper clipping with note.
Contact information, drafts of plays and press concerning different theatre projects involving Sandy Dwyer as writer/producer.
Greeting cards.

did.unittitle: Alyson Publications Leonard Matlovich Dress Kit.

scopecontent.p: Alyson Publications Leonard Matlovich Dress Kit

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Technical Sergeant Leonard P. Matlovich (July 6, 1943 – June 22, 1988)was a Vietnam War veteran, race relations instructor, and recipient of the Purple Heart and the Bronze Star. Matlovich was the first gay service member to purposely out himself to the military to fight their ban on gays.

did.unittitle: "Favorite Places Favorite Things" by Darel Hale.

scopecontent.p: Treatment for a play or monologue series.

did.physdesc: photocopies, printed paper, stapled paper, bound programs

scopecontent.p: Brochures and programs from Los Angeles area gay, lesbian and feminist organizations.
Poetry as well as a draft and printed versions of the essay " A Male Homosexual's Behavior Characteristics and Their Relationship to the fulfillment of Neurotic Needs."
Letters, meeting minutes and formatting mockups.
Rates and advertising analysis for the gay and lesbian newspaper founded and operated by Sandy Dwyer, The News.
Two copies of the confidential business plan for The News, the gay and lesbian newspaper founded and operated by Sandy Dwyer.
Receipts and completed forms required for filing a Fictitious Business Report along with a letter confirming status.
Twenty four page mockup of an issue of The News, a gay and lesbian newspaper founded and operated by Sandy Dwyer. Includes handwritten notes and pasted articles on graph paper.

did.physdesc: typewritten paper, handwritten notes, newspaper clippings

scopecontent.p: Style guide information, clippings about The News and/or other gay news outlets, mockups.
Includes the business plan for The News with commentary and assistance from Ron Norman as business adviser.

Includes notes and essays about plans for the management of The News, down to a daily scale. In addition, this folder contains correspondence with different constituencies concerning management issues.

did.physdesc: printed material, typewritten paper, onion skin paper

scopecontent.p: Letters, resume, published reading material and essays from Sandy Dwyer's time at the University of Missouri.
Inventory, Connexxus Anniversary Program, The News Program, Miscellaneous photographs.
Assignments and research materials for academic courses in psychiatry and women's studies, mainly focused on behavior patterns of homosexuals.
Visors, buttons, visitor cards and various ephemera.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Sandy Dwyer was a member and featured actor/writer involved with Apollo's Mice Theatre Company.

scopecontent.p: Includes programs and promotional materials for the play "Cheese and Crackers" by Sandy Dwyer as well as programs for "Grab Bag Cabaret," "Perfect Relationship," and "Haunted Host" which each featured Sandy Dwyer. This folder also contains Sandy Dwyer's headshots, reviews for several of the plays and a flyer for the Orange County Gay and Lesbian Resource Day.
Three copies of the play "Cheese and Crackers" by Sandy Dwyer.

did.physdesc: printed paper, envelopes, onion skin paper

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence regarding productions, theatrical events and education.
Correspondence with friends and colleagues, the bulk are greeting cards sent for birthday or holiday celebrations.

did.physdesc: printed paper, handwritten letters, greeting cards

scopecontent.p: Correspondence with friends, colleagues and family. The majority is made up of greeting cards.
Correspondence with Sandy Dwyer and her lover Danella. Some of the letters include annotations on letters from Danella by Sandy.

did.unittitle: Production Book for Bye Bye Birdie.

scopecontent.p: Production book used by Sandy Dwyer for a production of Bye Bye Birdie.
Headshots from different points in Sandy Dwyer's acting career, some under the name of Sandra Nelson. Also included are signed contracts with agents and actor's unions.
Production book used by Sandy Dwyer in a production of Talent Debut.
Miscellaneous scripts, no attribution or participation is noted or indicated on the scripts.
Programs, class information, newsletters and reviews from the Actor's Workshop.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Founded by Film/TV actor R.J. Adams in 1980, The Actors Workshop has been training aspiring and professional young film/television actors in both Los Angeles and Orange County, California.

scopecontent.p: Sandy Dwyer was cast in this play as the narrator but it never opened. Contained are working scripts.
Working script for Sandy Dwyer, who was cast in the role of Bernice.
Flyers and leaflets for various productions.
Reviews of shows and other media mentions of Sandy Dwyer.
Script and correspondence about the public service announcement "Crisis Counselor" in which Sandy Dwyer was cast as a lesbian mother involved in a custody battle.
Proposal and accompanying notes as well as correspondence written by Sandy Dwyer. The proposal was for a gay and lesbian theater company in Los Angeles.
Notes, statistics and information about the softball league in which Sandy Dwyer participated.
Greeting cards sent to Sandy Dwyer.
Greeting cards sent to Sandy Dwyer.
Logo for the gay and lesbian magazine founded and operated by Sandy Dwyer.
Notebooks of poetry from former lovers of Sandy Dwyer, personal calendars and drawings.
Articles written by Sandy Dwyer as well as photographs taken by Sandy Dwyer that were commissioned by or featured in Frontiers Magazine.
Poetry drafts and edits from two different notebooks in the collection.
Rough drafts of a poetry series written by Sandy Dwyer.
Poetry series by Sandy Dwyer, marked by her as "Originals."
Poetry collection written by Sandy Dwyer.
Employment records, test results, applications and resumes from Sandy Dwyer's tenure at the DPSS. This included time spent as a social worker, analyst and program assistant.
Certificate of appreciation from the city in appreciation of Sandy Dwyer's service on a jury as well as a certificate recognizing her participation in a softball league.
Typed drafts of various pieces of poetry collections by Sandy Dwyer.
"Jeans", "Labels", "Moments" and "Why I Write, all essays by Sandy Dwyer.
Medical handbook partially compiled by Sandy Dwyer.
Directory containing listings of medical and psychological services.
Rewrites of poetry from a collection by Sandy Dwyer.
Scripts for radio program "This Way Out."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: "This Way Out" is a weekly half-hour community radio program produced by and for LGBT people and their equality allies. The "magazine style" show is heard on more than 200 local stations around the world, via satellite to cable and home receivers in Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Middle East, and online via our podcasts (click on the link in the upper right-hand corner).
